examples: I get paid every other week.
Synonyms: disparate, dissimilar, distinctive, distinguishable, diverse; see also Thesaurus:different

entries.meaning: An other, another (person, etc), more often rendered as another.
examples: I'm afraid little Robbie does not always play well with others.

entries.meaning: The other one; the second of two.
examples: One boat is not better than the other.
Why not tell one or other of your parents?

verbs.description: other (third-person singular simple present others, present participle othering, simple past and past participle othered)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To regard, label, or treat as an "other", as not part of the same group; to view as different and alien.
(transitive) To treat as different or separate; segregate; ostracise.
examples: In this scenario, the young lady who had spoken had been othered by her peers and her response to my question had been dismissed as invalid despite the fact that she was alright.
